page.title: 11TRANSPORT (2)
page.content: The tourist potential of the line is enormous. At nearly all times of the year at weekends the trains which go from Skipton and Settle to Appleby and Carlisle are crowded; in the summer they are crowded every day as people take advantage of the chance to see the scenery of one of the most spectacular railways in Britain. In summer, too, steam trains ply the line, and people come from far and wide to watch and to photograph them. The trains can be seen from the windows of Settle High School, and when a steam train passes there is always great excitement. The line is also used when there is a blockage on the east or the west coast routes to the North--and the viaduct still holds!
